info.title: Site Search
info.description: Use these endpoints for searching content on your HubSpot hosted CMS website(s).
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: Build a site search bar to enable users to search through your website content.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the site search API to return HubSpot-hosted content based on search terms. Content can be searched across multiple domains. You can also retrieve all indexed data for a specific website page, blog post, or knowledge base article using its ID.

get.description: For a given account and document ID (page ID, blog post ID, HubDB row ID, etc.), return all indexed data for that document. This is useful when debugging why a particular document is not returned from a custom search.

parameters.name: contentId
parameters.description: ID of the target document when searching for indexed properties.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of document. Can be one of `SITE_PAGE`, `BLOG_POST`, or `KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE`.

html_other_nested.en.name: html_other_nested.en
values: We're committed to your privacy. HubSpot uses the information you provide to us to contact you about our relevant content, products, and services. You may unsubscribe from these communications at any time. For more information, check out our privacy policy .
This blog post is one of several Marketing Transformation Success Stories we'll be featuring in celebration of  Marketing Transformation Week , April 4-8, 2011.

get.description: Returns any website content matching the given search criteria for a given HubSpot account. Searches can be filtered by content type, domain, or URL path.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Specifies the number of results to be returned in a single response. Defaults to `10`. Maximum value is `100`.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to page through the results. If there are more results than specified by the `limit` parameter, you will need to use the value of offset returned in the previous request to get the next set of results.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: Specifies the language of content to be searched. This value must be a valid [ISO 639-1 language code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `es` for Spanish)

parameters.name: matchPrefix
parameters.description: Inverts the behavior of the pathPrefix filter when set to `false`. Defaults to `true`.

parameters.name: autocomplete
parameters.description: Specifies whether or not you are showing autocomplete results. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: popularityBoost
parameters.description: Specifies how strongly a result is boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 1.0.

parameters.name: boostLimit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum amount a result will be boosted based on its view count. Defaults to 5.0. Read more about elasticsearch boosting [here](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/mapping-boost.html).

parameters.name: boostRecent
parameters.description: Specifies a relative time window where scores of documents published outside this time window decay. This can only be used for blog posts. For example, boostRecent=10d will boost documents published within the last 10 days. Supported timeunits are ms (milliseconds), s (seconds), m (minutes), h (hours), d (days).

parameters.name: tableId
parameters.description: Specifies a specific HubDB table to search. Only returns results from the specified table. Can be used in tandem with the `hubdbQuery` parameter to further filter results.

parameters.name: hubdbQuery
parameters.description: Specify a HubDB query to further filter the search results.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: A domain to match search results for. Multiple domains can be provided with &.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specifies the type of content to search. Can be one or more of SITE_PAGE, LANDING_PAGE, BLOG_POST, LISTING_PAGE, and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE. Defaults to all content types except LANDING_PAGE and KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE

parameters.name: pathPrefix
parameters.description: Specifies a path prefix to filter search results. Will only return results with URL paths that start with the specified parameter. Can be used multiple times.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: Specifies which properties to include in the search. Options include `title`, `description`, and `html`. All properties will be searched by default.

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Specifies the length of the search results. Can be set to `LONG` or `SHORT`. `SHORT` will return the first 128 characters of the content's meta description. `LONG` will build a more detailed content snippet based on the html/content of the page.

parameters.name: groupId
parameters.description: Specifies which blog(s) to be searched by blog ID. Can be used multiple times to search more than one blog.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

combinedId.description: The ID of the document in HubSpot.

description.description: The result's description. The content will be determined by the value of `length` in the request.

type.description: The type of document. Can be `SITE_PAGE`, `LANDING_PAGE`, `BLOG_POST`, `LISTING_PAGE`, or `KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE`.

title.description: The title of the returned document.

tags.description: If a blog post, the tags associated with it.

rowId.description: If a dynamic page, the row ID in the HubDB table.

score.description: The matching score of the document.

domain.description: The domain the document is hosted on.

tableId.description: If a dynamic page, the ID of the HubDB table.

publishedDate.description: The date the content was published.

category.description: For knowledge articles, the category of the article.

subcategory.description: For knowledge articles, the subcategory of the article.

id.description: The ID of the document in HubSpot.

type.description: The type of document. Can be `SITE_PAGE`, `LANDING_PAGE`, `BLOG_POST`, `LISTING_PAGE`, or `KNOWLEDGE_ARTICLE`.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate
message.example: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)
